    Markdown Template

    Published: March 22, 2020 by

    • Categories:
    • website 1
    • Tags:
    • markdown 1

    Here are all the most important features I need for my post template and their markdown formats.

    This markdown article gave a nice introduction of markdown file. I got the formats to create sections, lists, links, and separation lines. To import images, I used HTML syntax like how kushdilip did. For bookmarks, I got the answer from Steve. For equations, I used MathJax.

    Section

    # This gives me titles

    The format of sentences and paragraphs follows LaTex. Use ` â€¦ ` for escaping.

    This gives me titles

    List

    *  List
    * Item

    Use indents to create nested items. The symbols will be different at each level automatically.

    • List
      • Item
    1.  List 1
    1. Item 1
    2. Item 2
2.  List 2
    1. Item 1
    2. Item 2
    1. List 1
      1. Item 1
      2. Item 2
    2. List 2
      1. Item 1
      2. Item 2

    Link

    go [there][1]
[1]:https:...

    Separation Lines

    ---

    Image

    <img src="turtle.jpg" alt="drawing" width="200"/>
<img src="https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1518467166778-b88f373ffec7?ixlib=rb-1.2.1&ixid=eyJhcHBfaWQiOjEyMDd9&auto=format&fit=crop&w=1778&q=80" alt="turtle1" width="200"/>

    I used HTML instead of another common approach ![]() because it's easier to scale the image under my theme template.

    Bookmark

    Take me [here](#bookmark)
Put anchor point <a name="bookmark"></a>

    Equation

    $$x_{1,2} = \frac{-b \pm \sqrt{b^2-4ac}}{2b}.$$
or
\begin{equation}x_{1,2} = \frac{-b \pm \sqrt{b^2-4ac}}{2b}\end{equation}

    I use MathJax instead of generating images directly from LaTex because it makes searching easier.

    To enable MathJax, do this in your script:

    <script type="text/javascript" async
  src="https://cdn.mathjax.org/mathjax/latest/MathJax.js?config=TeX-MML-AM_CHTML">
</script>
